body: Hrm yeah, I can see why this is not working. Not quite an easy fix. Sorry, but you will have to hold on a bit without this feature. :(

Cross posted from the Devise Google Group per Jose Valim's request:

I'm trying to invoke the rememberable hook on a user that I log in manually via the sign_in(user) method from the Devise helpers. However, when I do this, the rememberable hook doesn't seem to be called. Am I missing something? 

To compensate I dug into the Devise source to call the rememberable methods directly. This is brittle and thus I hope there's a better solution. 

Here's what I'm doing now and this works though it's not ideal. 

user = a_valid_persisted_user #pseudo code 
user.remember_me! 
sign_in(user) 
cookies.signed['remember_user_token'] = 
User.serialize_into_cookie(user) 

Note: devise :rememberable is in the User model
Yes, exactly. It won't work until I fix it. The same fix for both cases!
Hi, I'm experiencing the same issue. Is there any workaround for this bug?
Just ran into this myself, struggling to find a workaround.

Someone posted above that doing:

```
cookies.signed['remember_user_token'] =
```

User.serialize_into_cookie(user)

In your omniauth callback action should work. I have not tested personally.

The above solution set the cookie as a session one, so it will expire as soon as you close your browser.

You have to set the cookie expires to user.remember_expires_at.
Fixed on Devise master. You just need to set user.remember_me = true and call sign_in. Devise will do all the rest for you.

issue.title: Remember me confusion

repository.name: devise
repository.description: Flexible authentication solution for Rails with Warden.

issue.body:
There seems to be some confusion on how to get remember me working with Omniauth.

According to this [wiki](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/wiki/Omniauthable,-sign-out-action-and-rememberable), you need to have the following in your OmniauthCallbacksController:

```
remember_me(user)
```

On the other hand, according to this [issue](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/776), you just need to do this:

```
user.remember_me = true
```

In addition, making remember_me default to true according to [this](http://dev.mensfeld.pl/2013/12/rails-devise-and-remember_me-rememberable-by-default/), you just need to add the following to your User.rb

```
def remember_me
  true
end
```

Not sure which one is the official answer, and all three doesn't work for me. It only works for Chrome on Mac, but doesn't for Firefox Mac & Chrome Windows. Not sure what is going on.

My code looks like this:

```
# -*- encoding : utf-8 -*-
class OmniauthCallbacksController < Devise::OmniauthCallbacksController

    include Devise::Controllers::Rememberable

    def all
        omniauth = request.env["omniauth.auth"]
        auth = Authentication.find_by_provider_and_uid(omniauth['provider'], omniauth['uid'])
        if auth

            auth.update_with_omniauth omniauth
            auth.save!

            # ???
            remember_me auth.user
            auth.user.remember_me = true

            if user_signed_in?
                redirect_back_or settings_path(current_user)
            else
                sign_in_and_redirect auth.user, event: :authentication
            end
        else
            if user_signed_in?
                current_user.build_auth(omniauth).save!
                redirect_back_or settings_path(current_user)
            else
                session["devise.omniauth"] = omniauth.except('extra')
                redirect_to new_user_registration_url
            end
        end
    end

    alias_method :facebook, :all
    alias_method :twitter, :all

end
```

issue.title: Enable "Remember me" for OAuth

repository.name: RocketFuelLeakSite
repository.description: Website for Rocket Fuel Leak @ Stormreaver-EU

issue.body:
Users signing in with an OAuth provider should have their logins "remembered". This can be fixed by implementing the code described in [this device issue](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/776#issuecomment-807152).

Basically add `user.remember_me = true` before `sign_in_and_redirect`.

body:
@josevalim @prettynatty Once we are remembering users this way using a cookie post-OAuth authentication, how would you suggest setting up routes to check for a local cookie first?

Right now, my users click "Login with Venmo" and I don't check for this cookie, so the user is always forced to provide Venmo credentials in the standard OAuth login dialogue box: http://cl.ly/image/1n2a060k1m3a
